title: IRC Archive for channel #xwiki - XWiki

CalebJamesDeLisl - (00:10): Maybe I'll just go ahead and propose adding the API. I'm not sure what we need for methods maybe  EntityReference authenticate()  
CalebJamesDeLisl - (00:12): Thanks to the container module we don't really need to pass the request, but the container stores a generic request not a ServletRequest which means we would need some ugly casting to get the request.

sdumitriu - (11:35): Hm, critical bug on myxwiki  
sdumitriu - (11:35): Documents with spaces in their names are not accessible anymore  
sdumitriu - (11:35): http://incubator.myxwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Blog/Bait%20fishing  
sdumitriu - (11:35): http://incubator.myxwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Mockups/TODO%20Application%20Mockup  
sdumitriu - (11:35): They exist, they are listed in the index, they can be exported  
sdumitriu - (11:36): But they can't be viewed  
tmortagne - (11:41): hmm i think we now use the new xwiki-url module for some part of the URL parsing  
tmortagne - (11:41): could be the issue  
vmassol - (11:42): yes was thinking the same  
tmortagne - (11:42): (in trunk)  
vmassol - (11:42): I'm checking to see if I can reproduce with a unit test  
tmortagne - (11:42): maybe you forgot to unescape URL before parsing it  
vmassol - (11:43): yes someone like this probably  
vmassol - (11:43): s/someone/something/  
vmassol - (11:52): tmortagne: indeed in the algo I replaced there was an unencode after the parsing  
vmassol - (11:52): I do this in the factory but since we're not using the url factory but only the builder it's not done  
tmortagne - (11:53): (yes i meant after parsing not before)  
vmassol - (11:53): adding a test since thre was no test for that unfortunately  
jvelociter - (11:56): yep  
jvelociter - (11:56): wrong chan

vmassol - (12:06): nope xwiki-core  
vmassol - (12:07): xwiki-url is working fine  
vmassol - (12:07): so only xwiki-core to redeprloy  
vmassol - (12:07): redeploy

vmassol - (12:12): thanks thomas!  
tmortagne - (12:12): np

headache - (20:04): interesting topic about open source business in mailing list however i wonder there are some organizations who pay for the XWiki development except XWiki Sas  
plunden - (20:05): Hi, I wonder how one can include an object from another page and have its values viewed and edited like local objects.  
plunden - (20:06): I have seen several mentions about that possibility, but in XWiki Syntax 1.0.  
plunden - (20:07): Like having pages for each Member containing one object of MySpace.MemberClass (one member = one user) and being able to edit membership and user data in one page.  
plunden - (20:09): Those examples I mean are #includeForm(space.page)  
bblfish - (20:14): I want to add a remove a few elements from the html. Is this the right way to do it?  
bblfish - (20:14):  <script type="text/javascript">  
bblfish - (20:14):     document.observe("dom:loaded", function() {  
bblfish - (20:14):              var keygenElem = document.getElementById("spkac");  
bblfish - (20:14):                document.removeChild(keygenElem);  
bblfish - (20:14):                var advanced = document.getElementById("advanced");  
bblfish - (20:14):                advanced.setAttribute("type","hidden");  
bblfish - (20:14):                advanced.setAttribute("checked","true");  
bblfish - (20:14):     });  
bblfish - (20:14):    </script>

sdumitriu - (21:42): headache: Yes, lots of companies sponsor features  
hbansal - (21:43): Can we send our proposal directly to mentors ?  
sdumitriu - (21:45): Hi hbansal  
hbansal - (21:45): h  
hbansal - (21:45): i  
sdumitriu - (21:45): No, contacting the mentors directly is not a good practice  
hbansal - (21:45): k  
hbansal - (21:46): then mailing list  
hbansal - (21:46): ?  
sdumitriu - (21:46): It's early, the student registration phase didn't begin yet  
sdumitriu - (21:46): Yes, IRC and mailing list  
hbansal - (21:46): kk  
sdumitriu - (21:46): But just for general discussion now  
hbansal - (21:46): k  
sdumitriu - (21:49): bblfish: Try this:  
sdumitriu - (21:49): document.observe('dom:loaded', function() {  
sdumitriu - (21:49):   if($('spkac')) { $('spkac').remove(); }  
sdumitriu - (21:49):   $('advanced').writeAttribute('type', 'hidden').writeAttribute('checked');  
sdumitriu - (21:49): });  
bblfish - (21:49): ah that is nicer. Thanks. I had managed to get mine to work. Can't quite remember what the problem was...  
bblfish - (21:50):  <script type="text/javascript">  
bblfish - (21:50):     document.observe("dom:loaded", function() {  
bblfish - (21:50):         if (navigator.appName == "Microsoft Internet Explorer") {  
bblfish - (21:50):               var ke = document.getElementById('spkacRow');  
bblfish - (21:50):               ke.parentNode.removeChild(ke);  
bblfish - (21:50):               var advanced = document.getElementById('advanced');  
bblfish - (21:50):                advanced.setAttribute('checked','true');  
bblfish - (21:50):               var as= document.getElementById('advancedSpan');  
bblfish - (21:50):               as.setAttribute('class','hidden');  
bblfish - (21:50):        }  
bblfish - (21:50):     });  
headache - (21:51): sdumitriu, ok where i can submit a little mockup?  
sdumitriu - (21:51): bblfish: The problem was this: document.removeChild(keygenElem);  
bblfish - (21:51): yes that was it

headache - (21:51): for homepage
